page.title: 19Tyrells Manor, Stoke Hammond
page.content: There is a manor in Stoke Hammond which was built in 1703 as the{Tyrells {Estate Manor House.}In 1978 Mrs.Triefus bought it with the farm and 265 acres of land_3/4 of winter wheat and the rest is rough grazing for young cattle. The manor is a grade 2 Queen Anne style house. It has 11 rooms and 3 larders. They have a simming pool in the front garden now turned into a fish pond. There are many outer buildings. There is a silage pit an old dairy and a couple of dutch barns,17 stables and a long barn and some workshops. There are 15 young heifers. Stoke Hammond is vertually built around the manor,this is probably because the person who lived in the manor before Mrs.Triefus sold 195 acres to some people who built some houses on the land they have bought from her.
